ygData.subject: RE: Follow up questions to Arch-Magi Answers Volume V - 2.3.00
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep. This fact is posted on EQ Bard s Analysis site courtesy of Rokenn: http://rgonzalez.net/EQSongs/
ygData.messageBody:
Yep. This fact is posted on EQ Bard's Analysis site courtesy of Rokenn:

http://rgonzalez.net/EQSongs/

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Roach [mailto:mike.roach@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 10:39 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Follow up questions to Arch-Magi
> Answers Volume V
> - 2.3.00
>
>
> From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
>
> I was showing off for some newbie friends once at the
> chessboard in BB and I
> charmed a skeletal knight and told it to sit down. We all
> got a good laugh
> and I said, "when it stands back up, attack it...if you get
> in trouble I'll
> recharm it and let you heal up."
>
> Well, the skeleton broke charm and my two friends proceeded
> to beat the
> marrow of it. Keep in mind I have not struck the skeleton
> one, just charmed
> it. The fight lasted about a minute and the skeleton never
> stopped hitting
> me the whole time...it had absolutely no concern whatsoever
> that there were
> two con green PCs standing behind it killing it.
>
> "Hmmmmm...." I thought, and I helped my two friends get to
> their next level
> killing one yellow after another.
>
> I think charm has mem blur, doesn't it? I once saved myself
> from a KSing
> nuker in Highkeep by charming the gobbie he was trying to
> nuke while I was
> meleeing. Not knowing what was going on he continued to
> blow mana on it,
> then I let it break charm and finished it off.
>
> Faras
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> > Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 12:29 PM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Follow up questions to Arch-Magi
> > Answers Volume V
> > - 2.3.00
> >
> >
> > From: <kim@...>
> >
> > On Fri, 4 Feb 2000, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
> > >
> > > Q: Is Kellin's Lucid Lullaby (Lvl 15) supposed to have a
> > memory blur
> > > component?
> > > A: Nope.
> > >
> > > Follow up: The old spell lists from Beta indicate that
> > Lullaby nix'd the
> > > hate list. And in the first few months of retail it did so
> > as well (work
> >
> > As far as I could tell, this song never had a memory blur
> > component. Its taunt effect was sufficient to pull mobs off
> > others in most cases, but I never had an instance where I
> > could "rescue" a random player being beat up by a mob by
> > simply pulsing this song once.
> >
> > > Q: Ok this is a personal question and probably completely
> > trivial, the
> > > enameled black chestplate from lower guk is a black plate
> > that is wearable
> > > by all the plate wearing classes except Bard. I wear an
> > inferior black plate
> > > because I like the black plate look, can this plate be made
> > available to
> > > Bards?
> > > A: No reason. I changed it so that Bards can use it too -
> > should be in this
> > > patch.
> >
> > This actually went in a couple patches ago. I noticed it when
> > my paladin friend listed off the stats on a BE BP we got from
> > the Savant a couple weeks ago.
> >
> > --
> > John H. Kim
> > kim@...
> >
